quoteFirst: _Penshurst_ was making her usual 8 knots, and at 12.12 p.m. the enemy, as was expected, submerged. Although the Q-ship zigzagged and tried to make the enemy break surface astern and attack by gunfire, the German was too good at his own job, and at
title: Q-Ships and Their Story
author: Chatterton, E. Keble (Edward Keble), 1878-1944
